originalText.text: Bank teller is extremely rude. There’s an African American employee who suggested me to use the auto deposit machine which got stuck and swallowed all my money. There was not a single apology. And it takes forever to file a dispute and I have not get my money back.

text.text: Bank teller is extremely rude. There’s an African American employee who suggested me to use the auto deposit machine which got stuck and swallowed all my money. There was not a single apology. And it takes forever to file a dispute and I have not get my money back.

originalText.text: My friend and I (both in our 70s) had a wonderful meeting with Angel Diaz at the 850 Third Ave Chase Bank. He patiently answered all of our questions, gave us excellent advice and even showed us how to get activity printouts at the cash machine. He is the best and will be our banker and I highly recommend him to everyone.

originalText.text: Very organized an professionally trained personnel. Bankers make you feel at home, and answer your questions and concerns with such a great enthusiasm.  Artyom is private client representative has very good PERSONALITY and looks towards clients interest not his. They also provide water , and free pens for customers. And they ll try to get you the maximum bonus available . Will go there again.

originalText.text: I am a customer of Chase Bank since the time it was called "Chemical Bank".  Never have I had any problem and have always received good service until today, when I met a teller called Victoria.   She was rude and questioned my requests - starting with my request for hundred dollar billis in exchange of twentys which I had just withdrawn from the ATM machine.  She said "why did the ATM machine run ourt of hundred dollar bills?'  That was an odd thing to ask a customer also because she was not busy and was simply chatting and laughing with two of her other colleagues.  I was wondering if Chase paid her to chat and laugh with her colleagues or to help customers with their requests.  Throughout my time there she was rude, cocky and muttering under her breath.  She reluctantly gave me the hundred dollar bills and before I could put forward my second request she just stopped helping me which meant that I had to take out my ATM card for a second time.  I think Victoria definitely needs more training in how to deal with customers and people in general because working at a bank being a teller or a manager means being polite and knowing how to deal with customers with respect.  By the way the manager and other people at this Chase branch have always been very helpful, polite and give excellent customer service - except Victoria.
